Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevifactin (natural AMPs; lipopeptides; bacteria, prokaryotes; XXL)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  Attached by a hydrophobic moiety of octadecanoic (stearic) acid methyl ester at the C-terminus via forming an ester bond.Activity: Active against S. aureus, K. pneumoniae, E. faecalis, S. epidermidis, M. luteus, P. aeruginosa, E. coli, P. mirabilis, S. streptococcus, C. albicans. Warning: However, this molecule may also have undesired property to help bacterial biofilm formation.Updated 5/2016.
Literature Information.Author: Seghal Kiran G1, Anto Thomas T, Selvin J, Sabarathnam B, Lipton AP.2010
Literature Information.Title: Optimization and characterization of a new lipopeptide biosurfactant produced by marine Brevibacterium aureum MSA13 in solid state culture.
